e4: Switching to the new policy enhances transparency and aligns with ethical standards by reporting unbiased earnings. It mitigates legal risks of being perceived as misleading despite past investor awareness of the bias. Though there may be a transitional challenge in investor communication, the long-term benefit strengthens company credibility and aligns with honest financial reporting.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and completeness, avoiding intentional bias or manipulation. It should ensure that all stakeholders are adequately informed and not misled, fostering trust. Ethical considerations include the potential impact on all investors, especially retail ones, and compliance with legal and regulatory standards to prevent liability.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to effectively communicate the policy change to all investors, particularly retail investors, to ensure clarity. Additionally, what measures will be implemented to monitor market reactions and address misunderstandings or misinterpretations of the new reporting policy?
